page.title: 01BORDLEY BECK DRAINAGE GROUND
page.content: Part of the Mid-Craven Fault where the underlying geological strata is often exposed. Limestone outcrops break through the thin layer of fine turf across the north of the area which is well drained. Bordley Beck flows in an approximate north-south direction with feeder streams coming off the steep slopes on either side. These expose shales and gritstones in the gulleys. High ground south of the limestone is usually wet with a covering of poor, acidic vegetation. Lower slopes towards Bordley Beck have been drained and fertilised to provide hay, silage and grazing for sheep and cattle upon which the farming economy is based.
